Adaptation to mean climate changes can significantly reduce both the frequency and magnitude of losses, mitigating the risk of future extreme events. Changes in mean climate are a greater source of risk than variability; adaptation targeting mean changes is more effective. The exact value is not provided here, but is assessed to be a positive number given avoided impact.

Adaptation to mean climate changes can significantly reduce both the frequency and magnitude of losses, mitigating the risk of future extreme events. Changes in mean climate are a greater source of risk than variability; adaptation targeting mean changes is more effective. Refers to potential damages exceeding those of the 2012 event. The exact value is not provided here, but is assessed to be a positive number given economic benefit.
